description: An ospfIfStateChange trap signifies that there
has been a change in the state of a non-virtual
OSPF interface. This trap should be generated
when the interface state regresses (e.g., goes
from Dr to Down) or progresses to a terminal
state (i.e., Point-to-Point, DR Other, Dr, or
Backup).

event.Summary: OSPF router id $v1, interface $v2 state changed to $v3

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in
the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should
default to the value of one of the router's IP
interface addresses.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId

description: The IP address of this OSPF interface.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfIfStatusIpAddress

description: The OSPF Interface State.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfIfStatusState

description: An ospfIfStateChange trap signifies that there
has been a change in the state of an OSPF vir-
tual interface.
This trap should be generated when the inter-
face state regresses (e.g., goes from Point-
to-Point to Down) or progresses to a terminal
state (i.e., Point-to-Point).

event.Summary: OSPF router id $v1, virtual interface area id $v2 neighbor $v3 state changed to $v4

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in
the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should
default to the value of one of the router's IP
interface addresses.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId

description: The Transit Area that the Virtual Link traverses. By
definition, this is not 0.0.0.0
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfVirtIfStatusAreaID

description: The Router ID of the Virtual Neighbor.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfVirtIfStatusNeighbor

description: The OSPF virtual interfaces states.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfVirtIfStatusState

description: An ospfNbrStateChange trap signifies that
there has been a change in the state of a non-
virtual OSPF neighbor. This trap should be
generated when the neighbor state regresses
(e.g., goes from Attempt or Full to 1-Way or
Down) or progresses to a terminal state (e.g.
2-Way or Full). When an neighbor transitions
from or to Full on non-broadcast multi-access
and broadcast networks, the trap should be gen-
erated by the designated router. A designated
router transitioning to Down will be noted by
ospfIfStateChange.

event.Summary: OSPF router id $v1 neighbor area $v2, neighbor router id $v3 state changed to $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FOUNDRY-SN-ROUTER-TRAP-MIB::snOspfNbrStateChange FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfNbrIpAddr a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfNbrRtrId a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfNbrState i 1

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in
the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should
default to the value of one of the router's IP
interface addresses.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId

description: The IP address of this neighbor.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfNbrIpAddr

description: A 32-bit integer (represented as a type IpAddress)
uniquely identifying the neighboring router in the
Autonomous System.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfNbrRtrId

description: The State of the relationship with this Neigh-
bor.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfNbrState

description: An ospfIfStateChange trap signifies that there
has been a change in the state of an OSPF vir-
tual neighbor. This trap should be generated
when the neighbor state regresses (e.g., goes
from Attempt or Full to 1-Way or Down) or
progresses to a terminal state (e.g., Full).

event.Summary: OSPF router id $v1 virtual neighbor area $v2, virtual neighbor router id $v3 state changed to $v4

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in
the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should
default to the value of one of the router's IP
interface addresses.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId

description: The Transit Area Identifier.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfVirtNbrArea

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the neighboring
router in the Autonomous System.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfVirtNbrRtrId

description: The state of the Virtual Neighbor Relationship.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfVirtNbrState

description: An ospfIfConfigError trap signifies that a
packet has been received on a non-virtual in-
terface from a router whose configuration
parameters conflict with this router's confi-
guration parameters. Note that the event op-
tionMismatch should cause a trap only if it
prevents an adjacency from forming.

event.Summary: configuration error type $v4 with packet type $v5 has been received on interface $v2, router id $v1 from $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FOUNDRY-SN-ROUTER-TRAP-MIB::snOspfIfConfigError FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfIfStatusIpAddress a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfPacketSrc a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfConfigErrorType i 0 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfPacketType i 0

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in
the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should
default to the value of one of the router's IP
interface addresses.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId

description: The IP address of this OSPF interface.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfIfStatusIpAddress

description: The IP address of an inbound packet that can-
not be identified by a neighbor instance.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfPacketSrc

description: Potential types of configuration conflicts.
Used by the ospfConfigError and ospfConfigVir-
tError traps.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfConfigErrorType

description: OSPF packet types.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfPacketType

description: An ospfConfigError trap signifies that a pack-
et has been received on a virtual interface
from a router whose configuration parameters
conflict with this router's configuration
parameters. Note that the event optionMismatch
should cause a trap only if it prevents an ad-
jacency from forming.

event.Summary: configuration error type $v4 with packet type $v5 has been received on virtual interface area id $v2, router id $v1 from neighbor $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FOUNDRY-SN-ROUTER-TRAP-MIB::snOspfVirtIfConfigError FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfVirtIfStatusAreaID a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfVirtIfStatusNeighbor a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfConfigErrorType i 0 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfPacketType i 0

description: An ospfIfAuthFailure trap signifies that a
packet has been received on a non-virtual in-
terface from a router whose authentication key
or authentication type conflicts with this
router's authentication key or authentication
type.

description: An ospfTxRetransmit trap signifies than an
OSPF packet has been retransmitted on a non-
virtual interface. All packets that may be re-
transmitted are associated with an LSDB entry.
The LS type, LS ID, and Router ID are used to
identify the LSDB entry.

event.Summary: OSPF router id $v1, interface $v2 retransmited packet type $v4,LSDB type $v5, LSDB LS ID $v6 and LSDB router id $v7 to neightbor router id $v3

containing either a Router ID or an IP Address; it
identifies the piece of the routing domain that is
being described by the advertisement.

OSPF packet has been retransmitted on a virtual
interface. All packets that may be retransmit-
ted are associated with an LSDB entry. The LS
type, LS ID, and Router ID are used to identify
the LSDB entry.

event.Summary: OSPF router id $v1, virtual interface area id $v2 retransmited packet type $v4,LSDB type $v5, LSDB LS ID $v6 and LSDB router id $v7 to neightbor $v3

description: The 32 bit number that uniquely identifies the

variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfLsdbRouterId

description: An ospfOriginateLsa trap signifies that a new
LSA has been originated by this router. This
trap should not be invoked for simple refreshes
of LSAs (which happesn every 30 minutes), but
instead will only be invoked when an LSA is
(re)originated due to a topology change. Addi-
tionally, this trap does not include LSAs that
are being flushed because they have reached
MaxAge.

event.Summary: New LSA (area id $v2, type $v3, LS Id $v4 and router id $v5) has been originated by router id $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FOUNDRY-SN-ROUTER-TRAP-MIB::snOspfOriginateLsa FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfLsdbAreaId a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfLsdbType i 1 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfLsdbLsId a 192.0.1.2 FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfLsdbRouterId a 192.0.1.2

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in
the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should
default to the value of one of the router's IP
interface addresses.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId

description: The 32 bit identifier of the Area from which the LSA
was received.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfLsdbAreaId

description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link
state type has a separate advertisement format.

variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfLsdbRouterId

description: An ospfMaxAgeLsa trap signifies that one of
the LSA in the router's link-state database has
aged to MaxAge.

event.Summary: The LSA (area id $v2, type $v3, LS Id $v4 and router id $v5) in router id $v1 link-state database has aged to maximum age

description: An ospfLsdbOverflow trap signifies that the
number of LSAs in the router's link-state data-
base has exceeded ospfExtLsdbLimit.

event.Summary: The number of LSAs in the OSPF router id $v1 link-state database has exceeded $v2

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in
the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should
default to the value of one of the router's IP
interface addresses.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId

description: The maximum number of non-default AS-
external-LSAs entries that can be stored in the
link-state database. If the value is -1, then
there is no limit.
When the number of non-default AS-external-LSAs
in a router's link-state database reaches
ospfExtLsdbLimit, the router enters Overflow-
State. The router never holds more than
ospfExtLsdbLimit non-default AS-external-LSAs
in its database. OspfExtLsdbLimit MUST be set
identically in all routers attached to the OSPF
backbone and/or any regular OSPF area. (i.e.
OSPF stub areas and NSSAs are excluded).
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfExtLsdbLimit

description: An ospfLsdbApproachingOverflow trap signifies
that the number of LSAs in the router's link-
state database has exceeded ninety percent of
ospfExtLsdbLimit.

event.Summary: The number of LSAs in the OSPF router id $v1 link-state database has exceeded ninety percent of $v2

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in
the Autonomous System.
By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should
default to the value of one of the router's IP
interface addresses.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfRouterId

description: The maximum number of non-default AS-
external-LSAs entries that can be stored in the
link-state database. If the value is -1, then
there is no limit.
When the number of non-default AS-external-LSAs
in a router's link-state database reaches
ospfExtLsdbLimit, the router enters Overflow-
State. The router never holds more than
ospfExtLsdbLimit non-default AS-external-LSAs
in its database. OspfExtLsdbLimit MUST be set
identically in all routers attached to the OSPF
backbone and/or any regular OSPF area. (i.e.
OSPF stub areas and NSSAs are excluded).
variables.name: FOUNDRY-SN-OSPF-GROUP-MIB::snOspfExtLsdbLimit
